Body: Most algorithms for splitting text into sentences which I've found rely on punctuation being correct. However, in many real world applications, there will be substantial numbers of punctuation errors (missing periods, extraneous periods, etc.) Are there sentence-splitting algorithms which deal with this?
Title: Are there sentence boundary disambiguation algorithms which can handle punctuation errors with decent accuracy?
